Title:
Revisiting   common  bug prediction  findings    using
effort-aware    models
Published: Software Maintenance (ICSM), 2010 IEEE International Conference on
Elements_risk_assessment: we identify the dates of the introduction and fixing of a bug using the SZZ algorithm
UseOF-SZZ: to dentify when a bug was injected into the code and who injected it
Summary:
They revisit two common findings in the bug prediction literature: 1) Process metrics
     outperform product metrics, 2) Package-level predictions outperform file-level predictions
Outcome:
the first finding holds when effort is considered, while the second finding does not hold. These findings validate the practical
significance of prior findings in the bug prediction literature and encourage their adoption in practice
